## Instructions

Run the task-work skill in loop mode:

```
/task-work loop
```

Loop mode means: no confirmations, auto-resolve decisions, automation-eligible tasks only.

Exit when task work is complete or no eligible tasks remain.

availableCommands.name: keybindings-help
availableCommands.description: Use when the user wants to customize keyboard shortcuts, rebind keys, add chord bindings, or modify ~/.claude/keybindings.json. Examples: "rebind ctrl+s", "add a chord shortcut", "change the submit key", "customize keybindings". (bundled)

availableCommands.name: kspec
availableCommands.description: Use kspec CLI for task and spec management. Invoke when working with tasks, tracking work, capturing ideas, checking session status, or managing specs in this project. (project)

availableCommands.name: local-review
availableCommands.description: Pre-PR quality review - verify AC coverage, test quality, and test isolation. (project)

availableCommands.name: meta
availableCommands.description: Manage session context - focus, threads, questions, and observations. Use when tracking what you're working on, managing parallel work streams, or capturing friction points. (project)

availableCommands.name: pr
availableCommands.description: Create a pull request from current work. Handles branch creation, commits, push, and PR creation. (project)

availableCommands.name: pr-review
availableCommands.description: Review and merge a PR with quality gates. Verifies AC coverage and spec alignment before merge. Used in subagent context. (project)

availableCommands.name: reflect
availableCommands.description: Reflect on a session to identify learnings, friction points, and improvements. Captures valuable insights for future sessions. (project)

availableCommands.name: spec
availableCommands.description: Specification management - creating, organizing, and maintaining spec items with acceptance criteria and traits. (project)

availableCommands.name: spec-plan
availableCommands.description: Translate an approved plan into specs with acceptance criteria and derived tasks. Use after plan mode when transitioning to implementation. (project)

availableCommands.name: task-work
availableCommands.description: Work on a kspec task with proper lifecycle - verify, start, note, submit, PR, complete. (project)

availableCommands.name: triage
availableCommands.description: Triage inbox items systematically. Analyzes items against spec/tasks, categorizes them, and processes using spec-first approach. (project)

availableCommands.name: compact
availableCommands.description: Clear conversation history but keep a summary in context. Optional: /compact [instructions for summarization]

availableCommands.name: init
availableCommands.description: Initialize a new CLAUDE.md file with codebase documentation

availableCommands.name: pr-comments
availableCommands.description: Get comments from a GitHub pull request

availableCommands.name: security-review
availableCommands.description: Complete a security review of the pending changes on the current branch

Implement: Restart Checkpoint
────────────────────────────────────────
ULID:      01KGEP3W5FN57ZRVPBMGN1TPM9
Slugs:     task-restart-checkpoint
Type:      task
Status:    pending
Priority:  3
Automation: eligible
Spec ref:  @restart-checkpoint
Depends:
  @01KGEP4V → Add Zod schemas for checkpoint and IPC messages [completed]
  @task-supervisor-process-spawn → Implement: Supervisor Process Spawn [completed]
Created:   2026-02-02T08:04:43.823Z

─── Spec Context ───
Restart Checkpoint
Type: feature
Implementation: in_progress
Description:
  Checkpoint file format for persisting restart context. Checkpoints store session state, restart reason, and wake-up context that survives restarts.
Acceptance Criteria:
  [ac-1]
    Given: checkpoint created
    When: persisted
    Then: writes to .kbot/checkpoints/{ulid}.yaml
  [ac-2]
    Given: checkpoint file
    When: validated
    Then: contains: session_id, restart_reason, wake_context.prompt
  [ac-3]
    Given: restart_reason
    When: checkpoint created
    Then: accepts 'planned', 'upgrade', 'crash'
  [ac-4]
    Given: checkpoint > 24 hours old
    When: bot starts
    Then: ignores, logs warning
  [ac-5]
    Given: checkpoint consumed
    When: bot starts normally
    Then: deletes file after wake injection
  [ac-6]
    Given: checkpoint corrupted
    When: validation fails
    Then: logs error, starts without wake context
  [ac-7]
    Given: checkpoint format changes
    When: version field checked
    Then: handles migration or rejects incompatible
  [ac-8]
    Given: checkpoint write fails
    When: disk full/permissions
    Then: logs error, restart proceeds without checkpoint

─── Notes ───
[2026-02-02T08:04:43.822Z] @claude:
Implementation notes (auto-generated from spec):

Checkpoint file format for persisting restart context. Checkpoints store session state, restart reason, and wake-up context that survives restarts.


Acceptance Criteria:
- ac-1: Given checkpoint created, when persisted, then writes to .kbot/checkpoints/{ulid}.yaml
- ac-2: Given checkpoint file, when validated, then contains: session_id, restart_reason, wake_context.prompt
- ac-3: Given restart_reason, when checkpoint created, then accepts 'planned', 'upgrade', 'crash'
- ac-4: Given checkpoint > 24 hours old, when bot starts, then ignores, logs warning
- ac-5: Given checkpoint consumed, when bot starts normally, then deletes file after wake injection
- ac-6: Given checkpoint corrupted, when validation fails, then logs error, starts without wake context
- ac-7: Given checkpoint format changes, when version field checked, then handles migration or rejects incompatible
- ac-8: Given checkpoint write fails, when disk full/permissions, then logs error, restart proceeds without checkpoint
[2026-02-02T08:06:52.153Z] @claude:
Implementation approach:
- Checkpoint files stored at .kbot/checkpoints/{ulid}.yaml
- Use Zod schema for validation with version field for future migrations
- 24-hour TTL: ignore and warn if older
- File cleanup: delete after successful wake injection
- Graceful degradation: if corrupted/unreadable, log error and continue without wake context
- Key files:
  - packages/memory/src/shadow/shadow.ts (persistence pattern reference)
  - packages/supervisor/src/checkpoint.ts (new)

─── Inherited from @trait-validated ───
  [ac-1] (from @trait-validated)
    Given: invalid input

  [ac-2] (from @trait-validated)
    Given: missing required field
    When: detected
    Then: identifies field in error
  [ac-3] (from @trait-validated)
    Given: type mismatch
    When: detected
    Then: includes expected type in error

─── Inherited from @trait-recoverable ───
  [ac-1] (from @trait-recoverable)
    Given: crash mid-operation
    When: restarted
    Then: recovers from last checkpoint
  [ac-2] (from @trait-recoverable)
    Given: incomplete state
    When: detected
    Then: logs and attempts recovery
  [ac-3] (from @trait-recoverable)
    Given: unrecoverable state

    Then: emits error event with context (error details, operation state, recovery attempts); orchestrator determines escalation policy

Created:   2026-02-02T08:05:01.356Z

─── Spec Context ───
Supervisor Environment
Type: feature
Description:
  Environment variables set by supervisor when spawning kbot. Allows kbot to detect supervised mode and access restart functionality.
Acceptance Criteria:
  [ac-1]
    Given: supervisor spawns child
    When: environment set
    Then: KBOT_SUPERVISED=1 set
  [ac-2]
    Given: supervisor spawns child
    When: IPC open
    Then: KBOT_SUPERVISOR_PID={pid} set
  [ac-3]
    Given: bot starts
    When: KBOT_SUPERVISED=1
    Then: bot knows restart API available
  [ac-4]
    Given: restart after checkpoint
    When: child spawned
    Then: KBOT_CHECKPOINT_PATH={path} in env

─── Notes ───
[2026-02-02T08:05:01.355Z] @claude:
Implementation notes (auto-generated from spec):

Environment variables set by supervisor when spawning kbot. Allows kbot to detect supervised mode and access restart functionality.


Acceptance Criteria:
- ac-1: Given supervisor spawns child, when environment set, then KBOT_SUPERVISED=1 set
- ac-2: Given supervisor spawns child, when IPC open, then KBOT_SUPERVISOR_PID={pid} set
- ac-3: Given bot starts, when KBOT_SUPERVISED=1, then bot knows restart API available
- ac-4: Given restart after checkpoint, when child spawned, then KBOT_CHECKPOINT_PATH={path} in env
[2026-02-02T08:07:38.142Z] @claude:
Implementation approach:
- Environment variables set by supervisor when spawning:
  - KBOT_SUPERVISED=1 (always set when under supervisor)
  - KBOT_SUPERVISOR_PID={pid} (supervisor's PID)
  - KBOT_CHECKPOINT_PATH={path} (set during restart with checkpoint)
- Bot checks KBOT_SUPERVISED to know restart API is available
- Checkpoint path can be passed via env OR --checkpoint CLI arg
- Key files:
  - packages/supervisor/src/supervisor.ts (set env on spawn)
  - packages/bot/src/config.ts (read env vars)

    Given: checkpoint created
    When: persisted
    Then: writes to .kbot/checkpoints/{ulid}.yaml
  [ac-2]

    When: validated

  [ac-3]
    Given: restart_reason
    When: checkpoint created

  [ac-4]

    Given: checkpoint consumed

1→/**
     2→ * Bot Configuration
     3→ *
     4→ * Environment configuration loading and validation using Zod schemas.
     5→ *
     6→ * @see @bot-config
     7→ */
     8→
     9→import { z } from 'zod';
    10→
    11→/**
    12→ * Log level configuration
    13→ */
    14→export const LogLevelSchema = z.enum(['debug', 'info', 'warn', 'error']);
    15→export type LogLevel = z.infer<typeof LogLevelSchema>;
    16→
    17→/**
    18→ * Bot configuration schema with Zod validation
    19→ *
    20→ * Required fields:
    21→ * - discordToken: Discord bot token (DISCORD_TOKEN env var)
    22→ * - agentCommand: Command to spawn agent process (AGENT_COMMAND env var)
    23→ *
    24→ * Optional fields with defaults:
    25→ * - kbotDataDir: Data directory path (default: '.kbot')
    26→ * - logLevel: Logging level (default: 'info')
    27→ * - healthCheckInterval: Health check interval in ms (default: 30000)
    28→ * - shutdownTimeout: Graceful shutdown timeout in ms (default: 10000)
    29→ * - escalationChannel: Channel for escalation notifications (optional)
    30→ */
    31→export const BotConfigSchema = z.object({
    32→  // Required - no defaults
    33→  discordToken: z
    34→    .string({ required_error: 'DISCORD_TOKEN is required' })
    35→    .min(1, 'DISCORD_TOKEN is required'),
    36→  agentCommand: z
    37→    .string({ required_error: 'AGENT_COMMAND is required' })
    38→    .min(1, 'AGENT_COMMAND is required'),
    39→
    40→  // Optional with defaults
    41→  kbotDataDir: z.string().default('.kbot'),
    42→  logLevel: LogLevelSchema.default('info'),
    43→  healthCheckInterval: z.number().int().positive().default(30000),
    44→  shutdownTimeout: z.number().int().positive().default(10000),
    45→
    46→  // Optional - no defaults
    47→  escalationChannel: z.string().optional(),
    48→});
    49→
    50→export type BotConfig = z.infer<typeof BotConfigSchema>;
    51→
    52→/**
    53→ * Parse an optional environment variable as a number
    54→ *
    55→ * @param value - The environment variable value
    56→ * @param name - The environment variable name (for error messages)
    57→ * @returns The parsed number or undefined if value is empty
    58→ * @throws Error if value is present but not a valid integer
    59→ */
    60→function parseOptionalNumber(
    61→  value: string | undefined,
    62→  name: string,
    63→): number | undefined {
    64→  if (!value) return undefined;
    65→  const parsed = parseInt(value, 10);
    66→  if (Number.isNaN(parsed) || String(parsed) !== value.trim()) {
    67→    throw new Error(`Invalid integer for ${name}: "${value}"`);
    68→  }
    69→  return parsed;
    70→}
    71→
    72→/**
    73→ * Load and validate bot configuration from environment variables
    74→ *
    75→ * Environment variable mapping:
    76→ * - DISCORD_TOKEN -> discordToken (required)
    77→ * - AGENT_COMMAND -> agentCommand (required)
    78→ * - KBOT_DATA_DIR -> kbotDataDir (optional, default: '.kbot')
    79→ * - LOG_LEVEL -> logLevel (optional, default: 'info')
    80→ * - HEALTH_CHECK_INTERVAL -> healthCheckInterval (optional, default: 30000)
    81→ * - SHUTDOWN_TIMEOUT -> shutdownTimeout (optional, default: 10000)
    82→ * - ESCALATION_CHANNEL -> escalationChannel (optional)
    83→ *
    84→ * @returns Validated bot configuration

 * - ESCALATION_CHANNEL -> escalationChannel (optional)

}
